Article/0-0-0-18/how-to-deploy-a-nullsta.html:
With Nullstack it's easy to have your application up and running in production mode.<\/p>

üê±‚Äçüíª stonks<\/strong><\/p> <\/blockquote>

Nullstack compiles your code and all your dependencies using Webpack<\/a>.<\/p>

The output of the compilation is moved to the .production<\/strong> folder and is the only folder besides public<\/strong> that needs to be moved into the host machine.<\/p>

If you have project.cdn<\/code> set you must move the public<\/strong> folder to the actual cdn.<\/p>

üí° It is important that the .production<\/strong> folder is present for environment detection<\/p> <\/blockquote>

The host machine must have at least node v8.10.0 installed.<\/p>

You don't have to "npm install" in the host machine.<\/p>

‚ú® You can configure the environment using settings<\/code><\/a> and secrets<\/code><\/a><\/p> <\/blockquote>

To start the server just run:<\/p> 

node .<\/span>production/<\/span>server.<\/span>js
<\/code><\/pre>



‚ú® It is recommend the usage of a process manager like PM2<\/a><\/p>
<\/blockquote>

How to Deploy a static generated site with Nullstack<\/a><\/h2>
After you generate a static site<\/a>, all you have to do is move the output folder to any host machine capable of serving HTML.<\/p>

Examples<\/a><\/h2>
    

  • How to deploy to Vercel<\/a><\/li>

  • How to deploy to Github Pages<\/a><\/li>

  • How to deploy to Heroku<\/a><\/li>
<\/ul>
